00021 // These definitions are used to determine the filenames of each step
00022 // My naming format is as follows:
00023 // TYPE    VALUE   (Left/Right)    CLASS.csv
00024 //      where   TYPE is the name of the step eg. WalkForward, WalkTurn, etc
00025 //              VALUE is the 3 digit value associated with the step. 
00026 //                  For arcs it is the radius LeftXXX in cm. For turns it is the turn angle RightX.X in radians
00027 //              Left/Right is whether the step is a Left or Right step
00028 //              CLASS is the class of step eg. Start, Follow, FStop, NStop
00029 #define TYPE_NONE_NAME              string("NoStep")
00030 #define TYPE_FORWARD_NAME           string("WalkForward")
00031 #define TYPE_ARC_NAME               string("WalkArc")
00032 #define TYPE_DIAGONAL_NAME          string("WalkDiagonal")
00033 #define TYPE_SIDEWARD_NAME          string("WalkSideward")
00034 #define TYPE_TURN_NAME              string("WalkTurn")
00035 #define TYPE_BACKWARD_NAME          string("WalkBackward")
00036 
00037 #define CLASS_START_NAME            string("Start")
00038 #define CLASS_FOLLOW_NAME           string("Follow")
00039 #define CLASS_NORMAL_NAME           string("")
00040 #define CLASS_FSTOP_NAME            string("FStop")
00041 #define CLASS_NSTOP_NAME            string("NStop")
00042 
00043 #define LEFT_NAME                   string("Left")
00044 #define RIGHT_NAME                  string("Right")
00045 
00046 // Special gWalks will have StepDirections set to +/- 1000
00047 #define LEFT_INF                    1000
00048 #define RIGHT_INF                   -1000
00049 
00050 enum StepClassEnum 
00051 {
00052     CLASS_START,
00053     CLASS_FOLLOW,
00054     CLASS_NORMAL,
00055     CLASS_FSTOP,
00056     CLASS_NSTOP,
00057     CLASS_NUM_CLASSES
00058 };

00060 enum StepTypeEnum 
00061 {
00062     TYPE_NONE,      // that is don't take a step
00063     TYPE_FORWARD,
00064     TYPE_ARC,
00065     //TYPE_DIAGONAL,
00066     TYPE_SIDEWARD,
00067     TYPE_TURN,
00068     TYPE_BACKWARD,
00069     TYPE_NUM_TYPES
00070 };

00083 class Step
00084 {
00085     public:
00086         Step(string name);
00087         ~Step();
00088     
00089         void getNextFrame(float** positions, float** hardnesses);
00090         bool hasEnded();
00091         void getInitialPose(float** positions, float** hardnesses);
00092     
00093     private:
00094         void setStepProperties();
00095         void resetStep();
00096         void loadStep();                                    // load step and pose
00097         void loadSupportHardnesses();
00098         void useSupportHardnesses(float hardnesses[]);
00099         void readCSV(ifstream& file, float data[STEP_MAX_LENGTH][ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH]);       // read step file
00100         void readCSV(ifstream& file, float data[ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH]);                        // read pose file
00101     
00102     public:
00103         string Name;                        // the step's name (this will be used by higher levels to plan and connect steps together)
00104         float StepOriginalPositions[STEP_MAX_LENGTH][ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH];
00105         float StepPositions[STEP_MAX_LENGTH][ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH];
00106         float StepOriginalHardnesses[STEP_MAX_LENGTH][ALIAS_HARDNESS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH];
00107         float StepHardnesses[STEP_MAX_LENGTH][ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH];
00108         float StepSupportHardnesses[SM_NUM_MODES][SH_NUM_JOINTS];
00109         unsigned char StepLength;           // the step length in dcm cycles
00110         
00111         float StepDirection;                // the direction of the step (this is obtained from the 'Value' field in the filename, and has different meanings depending on the Type
00112         StepClassEnum StepClass;            // the class (Start, Follow, Normal, FStop, NStop)
00113         StepTypeEnum StepType;              // the type (Forward, Arc, Diagonal, Sideward, Turn, Backward)
00114         bool StepLeft;                      // true if this is a left step
00115         Step* NaturalNext;                  // the step which naturally follows this one
00116         Step* StopNext;                     // the stopping step which would follow this on if I wanted to stop 
00117     
00118     private:
00119         unsigned char StepCurrentIndex;     // the current index into StepPositions and StepHardnesses
00120         unsigned char StepWaitCount;        // the number of dcm cycles I have been waiting past the usual step end time
00121         int StepLastCallTime;
00122         unsigned char StepSwingCount;       // the number of consecutive swing support modes
00123         unsigned char StepPushCount;        // the number of consecutive push support modes
00124         
00125         float StepInitialPose[ALIAS_TARGETS_NOT_HEAD_LENGTH];
00126 };
